mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lee, Robert E. (Robert Edward), 1807-1870
mdRecord.dcterms:description: As one of his final duties as executor of the Custis family estate, Lee, with the guidance of his friend and agent Hamilton Neale, Esq., was charged with properly divesting the 438 acre Smith Island, a Custis family owned property located off Cape Charles, Va. in the Atlantic Ocean.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Neale, Hamilton S.
Custis family
Distribution of decedents' estates
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter from R. E. Lee to Hamilton S. Neale Esq., February 23, 1869 (correspondence)
